subject: Entrepreneurship
title: Instagram's Pivot From Burbn
description: A micro-lesson that makes Instagram's Pivot From Burbn usable.

hook.text: Before Instagram, Kevin Systrom built Burbnâ€”a location-sharing app with too many features.

buildup.text: Burbn could check in, make plans, earn points, and share photos. Users were confused and overwhelmed.

discovery.text: Systrom analyzed the data and found one feature people actually used: sharing photos with filters.

twist.text: He stripped away everything else. The new app did exactly one thing. He called it Instagram.

climax.text: Instagram hit one million users in just two months. Facebook bought it for $1 billion in 2012.

punchline.text: Sometimes the best product is the one with less.

quiz.question: What did Kevin Systrom discover when he analyzed Burbn's user data?
options: Users wanted more social features and location tracking
